answers.answer: Try drinking more water and put your legs up as much as possible. With my first pregnancy my doctor told me to do that and also to cut back on salt. Hope that helps,I know it can me really uncomfortable.
Have you had this through the pregnancy or it has just started? If it's suddenly started then you need to be checked out.
It started a couple of weeks back but only as a tingling sensation. Lately it got worse, started aching and wakes me up at night. I've had to take off my rings now...
thanks for tips. the salt thing *****, as i already have to watch my diet enough because of pregnancy diabetes. but there you go... only six weeks left to endure before my angel comes! :)
Please go get check I had a friend with water retention it lead to a still birth at 38 weeks please please watch out and take care of your self

question: hi ladies! i'm in week 33 and startwd swelling up in my body. worst is my arms and hands. anyone got any tips on how to keep the swelling to a minimum?
title: water retention
